headline: Greek Pasta Salad
description: This Greek pasta salad has all the refreshing flavors of a classic Greek salad thanks to the addition of tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese.
name: Greek Pasta Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in penne and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes; rinse with cold water and drain well.
Whisk olive oil, vinegar, garlic, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper together in a bowl; set aside.

Combine pasta, tomatoes, green and red peppers, onion, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese in a large bowl. Pour vinaigrette over the pasta mixture and mix well. Cover and chill for 3 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious!! Will keep for future for sure!

Really lovely pasta salad! Thank you! I don't eat bell peppers so I swapped those for 1 stick of celery, extra cucumber, and extra tomatoes. Also decreased the red onion to 1/4 of a large onion so that it wouldn't be too overpowering. Added a handful of sliced kalamata olives and extra feta. Dressing is perfect, especially with fresh oregano! Such a delicious and easy lunch recipe :)
Excellent! Great recipe. I added cubed salami.
Amazing recipe, I used fresh oregano from my garden with chives in the dressing, used processer to blend . So delish
I make this often. I like to add a little mayo to the dressing - not much, just enough to emulsify.

Simple, yet absolutely delicious. I have come back to this recipe time and time again, because its a no fail! I usually double my dressing and give it just a little touch up from sitting in the fridge for 3 or more hours. :)

This was a tasty and refreshing pasta salad. I was looking for something without mayo and this was it. I didn’t really make changes, just used up the entire cucumber so I wouldn’t have any left over, used most of my can of black olives for the same reason. The whole family loved it and I’m actually making it again today!
Lots of chopping bit very good on a hot summer day.
No
This is my go to pasta salad. I use tri color rotini instead of penne. Its always the star of the show when I make it and it goes fast!

This is a wonderful pasta salad. I did find that even though I tripled the recipe, tripling all ingredients but the olive oil, it was still awesome. (Just knew it would be far too oily with 2 CUPS of oil.) Also, improvising with additional veggies (or those you have on hand) works fine and does not take any credit away from submitter Danielle for a great recipe! Thank you!
Very good
Used a full cup of Kalamata olives instead of plain black olives for a flavorful kick!
Beautiful and delicious pasta salad! I used mozzarella pearls instead of feta. Will make again!
Fantastic!
Tri-color penne, added fresh lemon thyme from our herb garden. Everyone loved it!

This was great for a potluck. I pretty much followed the recipe as written. I ended up adding additional salt, pepper, and feta after it sit in fridge overnight. I’m glad I didn’t take it all, as it was great with my next day lunch of grilled burger! Thank you for the recipe: it’s a keeper.

The dressing smells and taste delicious and tangy. The only change I made is I put the feta cheese on top and did not stir it in yet, not until it chills for 2 to 3 hours first , just a personal preference . Thanks for sharing this recipe!
The only change I made was using tri-color rotini instead of penne. I thought it was lacking a little bit of flavor, but everyone raved about it at the work potluck, so it must be good!
I left the olives on the side for people to add as desired as I don't like olives. Even without, the salad tasted great. A good pot luck dish; people really liked it.

This is a nice pasta and the dressing is great. I would just change the noodles from penne to something a bit smaller. I used GF noodles, though, so that might have been my problem. If you use GF go with a smaller noodle. Maybe an elbow? 

Also, in keeping with the Greek theme, I think kalamata olives would have been a better option than the black. I'll switch it up next time.
I’ve made this over and over! It’s so good! I make the night before. I’ve added canned clump crab and dill and more feta and it’s amazing!
loved this. I would put this dressing on any salad, it was wonderdul.
So happy to find a recipe that doesn't call for sure bought dressing! I used it as a guide and it's delicious!!!

We added cooked garbanzo beans to make this a complete meal and it was a huge hit. We didn’t use fresh garlic but instead substituted 1/4 tsp of garlic powder, and upped the oregano. Kids gobbled it up and asked for it again the next week.

Agree with some others who have stated that the dressing was bitter. The dressing is really the only thing you need a recipe for as the rest is just pasta and diced veggies. I added sugar to make the dressing less bitter but I think balsamic may work a bit better than the red wine vinegar next time. Also added some Chili flakes and garlic powder as I thought the salad was lacking flavour.
I used up some whole wheat rotini and added canned quartered artichokes. I love that the dressing does not have sugar in it!
Delicious! I squeezed a whole lemon and used grape tomatoes. The whole family loved it.
It was the best pasta salad I ever ate. I am going to have to watch that I don’t make it too often because I don’t want to get sick of it. It is a five star receipt for sure.
Used half of the oregano and added Greek seasoning for the other half. I tripled the recipe and my large family devoured it.

This is a great pasta salad dressing ! My kids love it! I love that the salad part is so versatile, you can add just about any fresh vegetables or left-over veggies you have on hand, however, do not add add any lettuce/spinach, grated (only), shaved is fine, parmesan cheese, chick peas/garbanzo beans or chicken until ready to serve . The dressing is absolutely fabulous on it's own but can also be modified to fit personal taste, occasion or meal. I.E. white wine vinegar instead of red, amounts to fit your taste: Dill, Basil, Lemon Zest, Honey, Dijon Mustard, Salt & Pepper. Also great as a marinade for chicken, but use red wine vinegar. For pasta you can use any you have on hand from angel hair to ziti, or zoodles, spaghetti squash, orzo, or large pasta shells. This is so easy and can accommodate just about any taste. I'm making a 'mom's cookbook ' for my daughter for when she heads of to college in 2 years and this is a perfect recipe for a novice cook. It is a perfect addition, easy to make, able to use what is on hand, adaptable but will still give her a taste of home. I just hope she doesn't get distracted while cutting up the veggies and cut herself Also, for those whose family say they don't like Feta Cheese, crumble it up in to small bits, don't mention it's in there (unless of course they have an allergy) and guarantee they will like it. It is the one addition that is absolutely required to balance the dressing and make it a hit and craveable. Thanks Daniell
Very good. I cut the oregano in half and used 1 clove garlic.
Excellent flavour
I added marinated artichoke hearts along with a little of the dressing. I served it slightly warm with pepperocini's, kalamata olives and lemon wedges on the side. So yummy!
Loved the ingredients but the dressing was way too bitter for our taste.

I agree it's a litter bitter, I just throw 1tsp of stevia/erythritol blend into the dressing before I blend it up. I use red lentil rotini to make it more of a meal and more nutrient-dense and it comes out beautifully! I really love this one.
very good just added a few more spices, good basic recipe!
Great summer salad! Bright taste with veggies, tangy feta cheese crumbles and complementary vinaigrette. This is an easy recipe to make .
Great overall flavor and was loved by family and friends. I did cut back on the oregano and substituted a red pepper for the tomatoes. Better if made the day before.
This was very good and didn't last very long in my house!!
Very good! Made as is. Loved the garlic in the dressing!
Tasty!!! Plus, it's a great potluck choice for folks who are vegetarian.

This turned out great. I made a few substitutions mainly because it’s what I had on hand. I used tricolour rotini and 3 different coloured peppers for colour. I used a variety of small different coloured tomatoes. I ran out of red wine vinegar so used have white wine vinegar.
Loved it just as it is.
I doubled for my family of 6. I also used rotini pasta instead.

What I did was went to the local Grocery store and got the Olives medley from the Olive bar, I used the juice from the olives as well as I used the small balls of Mozzarella. I went to the deli and got 1/4 slices(4) of Provolone cheese, (4) slices of 1/4 Swiss, cut it up using a pizza cutter cause of it being faster. Doing it the way I did I eliminated using any salad dressing, the last thing I put in was shredded Parm cheese. I used the Rainbow pasta.If you want it a little spicy put the small pepperoni in it
Fantastic Greek pasta salad. Beautiful taste, all the ingredients really worked together. Chilling it for at least three hours (or overnight) really does enhance the taste!
Screw the nasty canned black olives, I used calamata olives.

This recipe makes a large amount. I took it for church supper and ALL GONE! The flavors are still individual while somehow melting into one giant delicious whole. This is so basic and good that I am surprised I haven't seen this one before. Saved it and will use it again. Thank You Danielle!

I make this all the time - it's my favorite pasta salad. I only change a few ingredients due to preference but I use the dressing as it and it's fabulous. I used spiral pasta instead of Penne, yellow pepper instead of green and green onions instead of red.
I make this pasta salad every time my family has a function. I do not make the dressing. I always use Christie's Greek Salad Dressing. It is always a crowd please
Followed the recipe exact, however replaced the dried with fresh herbs from the garden. It's an amazing recipe!
I added ham to it just for fun and my pasta drank up the dressing...had to add more. Great salad, thanks!
Fantastic Greek pasta salad. My whole family loves it so much. I added artichoke hearts and it came out amazing.
Quick and easy. I made it for a hot summer meal to be eaten with some roasted chicken from the grocery store. Too hot to cook!

I made this last weekend for a family bbq. I made the recipe exactly as it is, but was disappointed with the bitter flavour of the extra virgin olive oil. I will make the recipe again, but with regular olive oil next time and I'm sure that I'll be able to improve my rating of it.
Perfect! Light, refreshing and filling.

This was an excellent pasta salad to make and eat during our 112 degree heatwave here in Southern California! I did have to make a change and use 1 cup of a bottled balsamic salad dressing as my red wine vinegar was way past its expiration date but it was still very yummy. Will definitely make again but with some fresh red wine vinegar next time!
Easy to make and was very good, will make again!
I used Kraft balsamic dressing instead of red wine vinegar and olive oil. Omitted the olives and used regular tomatoes but took out seeds.
I made this as written. It was very good.

Made this last night for my husbands office. Super delicious and it got RAVE reviews from my husband’s office...even someone who doesn’t like veggies went back for seconds! The only thing o change was the pasta, I used rotini. I’ll be making this for us at home very soon!
This is a great recipe. Only change I made was used I different type of pasta

I make a huge pile of this every Easter for our 24 to 28 family, kids, and grand kids.
Love it. But I do buy an off-the-shelf dressing called Greek Feta from a specialty store.The women make everything else after I've destroyed the kitchen.
Combined with Greek Pasta Salad I for more ideas on ingredients. Amazing recipe!
This is an excellent base for a pasta salad. I only added a few Tablespoons of balsamic vinegar and the dressing was of a balanced acidity.

Outstanding. The dressing is absolutely fantastic. I've never cared for pasta salad until I tried this one, now it's my go-to for summer pot-lucks, cook-outs, etc. My teenagers absolutely love it and ask for it!

This looks so so awesome!!!
I would love to eat this!!!
Love this recipe !! Added a little more feta, also only had elbow noodles which worked fine as well. So great for next day lunches. My husbands extremely picky and he loved it.
This was gone so fast I had to make it again the next day.
This was pretty good. Found it to be a little dry after the first day.

This could be a 5 star recipe, but I made so many changes I could not honestly give it that rating. SO- I was looking for a way to use all the squash that I get in the summer. Sometimes they get too big so I thought about a salad.
This recipe gave me the basics. I trimmed by mongo squash and chopped it into cubes. Then added Feta, Kalamata olives, tomatoes, 1/ cuke, basil and Italian dressing. Wow-was that yummy- and crunchy too! I made so much I had leftover and it was better the next day and still very crunchy! 
So, as you sub zuccs for pasta in other dishes I did the same thing here. Very good!

I could only give 2 stars due to the fact that I did not think the peppers complimented this salad at all. In addition, the picture of this salad has artichoke and chickpeas in it. These are not ingredients in the recipe.

Love this recipe 
Of course I didn't have red wine vinegar so I used some red wine and Apple cider vinegar. No black olives, used green olives. No cucumbers, used artichoke hearts. Fresh oregano & cherry tomatoes from my garden. Turned out FANTASTIC.
The tri-color rotini makes for a more colorful serving. Saw artichokes in the photos so I added those too. I prefer a dish, like this, that can be made ahead of time when we have company.

Everyone loved this dish! I added artichokes, used mostly white vinegar, and used rotini tri-colored pasta. Super colorful and pretty for summer! I also added a little extra cheese and used a greek olive mix and grape tomatoes. I made this the morning of serving, and poured 1/2 the dressing on then, and the other half at serving.
We loved this recipe. We doubled the vegetables, garlic, olives and feta that the recipe calls for to suit our taste. We kept the dressing the same. I will make this again, it's delicious.
i love it it was yummy and i wouldn't change it again

A good base for Greek pasta salad. I ended up with twice as much vinaigrette as I needed, even though I added a can of garbanzo beans and some chicken (marinated and cooked). It was also too garlicky for me, and I love garlic! 
Recommended add-ins:
garbanzo beans
grilled or pan-fried chicken marinated in lemon juice, olive oil and Greek seasonings
kalamata olives instead of black olives
sun-dried tomatoes are a really tasty replacement for cherry tomatoes
Everyone loved it. I changed the black olives for sliced Greek olives and sliced Spanish olives.

This recipe is a good base for an awesome pasta salad. I used Kalamata black olives, added a little Balsamic vinegar, threw in a small jar of chopped artichoke hearts (including the oil) and added about a cup of broccoli florets. I also held the salt and pepper until serving since there are so many varying tastes for those and we always have the salt and pepper mills handy, as needed. I'll definitely be making this often.
The dressing is perfection! I messed with the other ingredients to suit my taste, but followed the dressing recipe exactly and it's delicious! My salad turned out great.

I made it for lunch and my mom-dad and daughter loved it. The colours are so vibrant and is so yum. It's a favourite now and I will be making it quite frequently this summer. Many thanks for such a yum salad ??
Simple and comes out great every time. No substitutions are necessary but I've subbed different veggies such as broccoli or sun dried tomato and it's always come out well.
I blanched zucchini and yellow squash, I dice them up and put in the pasta in place of cucumber.

This recipe makes the best Greek pasta salad ever!!! I used penne pasta but may try rotini next time just for a change. I needed a large quantity to take to a party so I doubled all ingredients except for oregano. Superb!!!

Love it! I just needed a recipe for dressing and ratios of ingredients. I was able to take the dressing add a few touches (sugar, & suggested dill, honey) with those added ingredients it turned out fantastic. I have to alter some of the main ingredients to fit my family's taste buds. Great recipe foundation!

Love this recipe. It's a go-to make ahead salad for when guests are coming to town. The pic includes artichoke hearts, but the recipes does not call for them. I love artichoke hearts, so I always include.

Took this to a party and was begged for the recipe by many people! This is a fantastic Greek pasta salad! The only changes I made are ones I've read here from other members. Tri-color rotini, more salt and pepper, and grape tomatoes instead of cherry :)
Made this several times and it's always a favorite from guests and family. Mmmm
Really really good!

I’ve made this twice now, both times for guests, and it has been very well received. My SIL, who does not like pasta salads, took a spoonful to be polite. Much to everyone’s astonishment, he asked for seconds and then thirds and THEN took a bowl home to have in his lunch tomorrow. What more could one want from a recipe? I think its all in the dressing, a simple mix that is not too over-powering so it allows the flavour of the veggies to shine through. I increased the garlic by one clove and I added a teaspoon of Dijon mustard to the dressing just because I like it in a dressing. The first time I used garlic stuffed green olives sliced, as that is what I had on hand. Tonight I used pitted Kalamata olives but left them whole so that the SIL could pick them out. Good thing to do when you are questioning who likes olives.
Made this for the Fourth of July. It was a big hit!

EXCELLENT 
used red wine instead of red wine vinegar
also cut recipe in half as we are only two people

This pasta salad was a hit at our July 4th barbeque! I took the lead from a few suggestions and used kalamata olives, chopped artichoke hearts and a little dill for extra flavor. I also added about a teaspoon of sugar to the dressing to lower the acidity. I would make this again and prepare it the night before so the flavors can really fuse. This will be a bbq and potluck staple.

This is an easy recipe - I make it even easier by using Newman's own Greek salad dressing instead of making it. I am not a fan of red peppers so I substitute with other veggies - - snow peas, cauliflower, broccoli or anything else on hand.
Super tasty and easy to make! I added green olives, artichoke hearts and chick peas and substituted Raspberry Blush for Red Wine Vinegar. Huge hit!

Fantastic salad! I followed reviewers' comments for modifications, e.g. white wine vinegar instead of red, grape tomatoes instead of cherry, a little more cheese, adding dill to counteract oregano, etc. Thanks for the helpful suggestions. The picture that accompanies this recipe shows tricolored rotini and artichoke hearts, so I that's what I used as well. Kudos for a great recipe!
I added artichoke hearts. Recommended.
